required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 2 Study of Viagenpumatucel-L (HS-110) in Patients With Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Viagenpumatucel-L (HS-110) in Combination With Low Dose (Metronomic) Cyclophosphamide Versus Chemotherapy Alone in Patients With Non-Small Cell Lung Adenocarcinoma After Failure of Two or Three Previous Treatment Regimens for Advanced Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Determine whether viagenpumatucel-L combined with low-dose cyclophosphamide prolongs survival in patients with NSCLC who failed 2 or 3 prior lines of therapy for incurable or metastatic disease compared with chemotherapy alone.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will test whether vaccination with viagenpumatucel-L combined with low-dose cyclophosphamide will prolong the survival of patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have failed 2 or 3 prior lines of therapy for incurable or metastatic disease compared with chemotherapy alone. Patients will be randomized 2 to 1 into the viagenpumatucel-L arm and the chemotherapy alone arm, respectively.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sponsor Decision; strategic - based on changing treatment landscape

primary_outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) calculated as the duration of survival from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause, or was censored on the date the patient was last known to be alive. Survival time was calculated from the randomization date up to the date of death,or censored on the date that the patient was last known to be alive (last available visit date) utilizing Kaplan-Meier Estimate of Overall Survival Ending Events

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Adverse Events: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the safety of the combination of viagenpumatucel-L and low-dose cyclophosphamide by frequency of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
Evaluate overall immune-related DCR (irDCR) and also DCR by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) (complete response, partial response, and stable disease)
Evaluate 6-month immune-related DCR (6m-irDCR) and also 6mDCR by RECIST (complete response, partial response, and stable disease at 6 months following randomization)
Evaluate immune-related ORR (irORR) and also ORR by RECIST (complete response and partial response)
Evaluate immune-related PFS (irPFS) and PFS by RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors)
Evaluate immune-related TTP (irTTP) and also TTP (Time to Progression) by RECIST
Evaluate the proportion of patients who are alive at 6 months following randomization
Evaluate the proportion of patients who are alive at 12 months following randomization

Characterize the peripheral blood immunologic response via intracellular cytokine staining (ICS) by flow cytometry and/or enzyme-linked immunosorbent spot (ELISPOT) on cluster of differentiation 8 positive (CD8+) cells following vaccination

arm_group.description: Viagenpumatucel-L (HS-110) given as 1*10^7 cells for 12 weekly injections followed by injections every 9 weeks for up to 12 months or until discontinuation from study treatment, whichever occurs first, plus metronomic cyclophosphamide therapy for the first 12 weeks.
Patients will be treated with a physician's choice regimen until progression.

intervention.description: Vaccine derived from irradiated human lung cancer cells genetically engineered to continually secrete gp96-Ig
One 50mg tablet administered orally daily for 7 days on alternating weeks for a total of 6 weeks of therapy over 12 weeks

intervention.intervention_name: Physician's Choice Regimen (Vinorelbine, Erlotinib, Gemcitabine, Paclitaxel, Docetaxel, Pemetrexed)
intervention.description: Physician will select one of the following to be given in nominal 21 day cycles with dose and route according to investigator's standard practice: Vinorelbine Erlotinib Gemcitabine Paclitaxel Docetaxel Pemetrexed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-small cell lung adenocarcinoma
- At least 2 and no more than 3 prior lines of therapy for incurable or metastatic NSCLC
- Suitable for conventional single agent chemotherapy
- Disease progression at study entry
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status (PS) â‰¤ 1; PS=2 patients may be considered
- Central nervous system (CNS) metastases may be permitted but must be treated and neurologically stable
- Adequate laboratory parameters
- Willing and able to comply with the protocol and sign informed consent
- Female patients who are of childbearing potential and fertile male patients must agree to use an effective form of contraception throughout study participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received systemic anticancer therapy or radiation therapy within the previous 14 days
- Received more than 3 lines of prior conventional therapy for advanced disease
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis B or C, or severe/uncontrolled infections or intercurrent illness, unrelated to the tumor, requiring active therapy
- Any condition requiring concurrent systemic immunosuppressive therapy
- Known immunodeficiency disorders
- Known leptomeningeal disease
- Other active malignancies
- Prior treatment with a cancer vaccine for this indication
- Pregnant or breastfeeding

facility.name: University of California at Los Angeles
University of Maryland Greenebaum Cancer Center
Providence Portland Medical Center- Providence Lung Cancer Clinic
Texas Oncology PA Texas Cancer Center

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Viagenpumatucel-L Plus Metronomic Cyclophosphamide
group.description: Viagenpumatucel-L (HS-110) given as 1*10^7 cells for 12 weekly injections followed by injections every 9 weeks for up to 12 months or until discontinuation from study treatment, whichever occurs first, plus metronomic cyclophosphamide therapy for the first 12 weeks. Viagenpumatucel-L: Vaccine derived from irradiated human lung cancer cells genetically engineered to continually secrete gp96-Ig Metronomic Cyclophosphamide: One 50mg tablet administered orally daily for 7 days on alternating weeks for a total of 6 weeks of therapy over 12 weeks

group.title: Chemotherapy Alone
group.description: Patients will be treated with a physician's choice regimen until progression. Physician's Choice Regimen (Vinorelbine, Erlotinib, Gemcitabine, Paclitaxel, Docetaxel, Pemetrexed): Physician will select one of the following to be given in nominal 21 day cycles with dose and route according to investigator's standard practice: Vinorelbine Erlotinib Gemcitabine Paclitaxel Docetaxel Pemetrexed

baseline.population: Sixty-six of the original 123 planned patients were enrolled from June 2014 to 10 September 2015. Patients were randomized in a 2:1 ratio in the experimental group (n=45) and the control group (n=21). Sixty-three patients were included in the safety population.

analysis.groups_desc: With only 50% of enrollment complete prior to study termination by sponsor, insufficient sample size exists to fully complete efficacy analysis.

outcome.title: Frequency of Adverse Events: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE)
outcome.description: Evaluate the safety of the combination of viagenpumatucel-L and low-dose cyclophosphamide by frequency of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
outcome.population: Safety was defined as the number of adverse events (AE)/serious adverse events (SAE) in patients receiving viagenpumatucel-L and low-dose Cyclophosphamide (CY).

class.title: At least one TEAE Leading to Tx Discontinuation
At least one TEAE Leading to a Dose Reduction

outcome.title: Disease Control Rate (DCR)
outcome.description: Evaluate overall immune-related DCR (irDCR) and also DCR by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) (complete response, partial response, and stable disease)
outcome.population: Data were not collected for Outcome Measure 3 due to study termination (50% enrollment) by the Sponsor on 01 September 2015 due to changing treatment landscape (PD-1 approvals), and a subsequent change in development focus to Immuno-Oncology (IO) combinations. See NCT02439450.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Evaluate immune-related PFS (irPFS) and PFS by RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria for Solid Tumors)
outcome.population: Calculated from randomization date to earliest date of first 'Progressive Disease' response (Immune-Related / RECIST Response Criteria) or date of death, and censored on the date of the last available post-baseline tumor assessment.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study was discontinued prematurely (50% enrollment) by the Sponsor on 01 September 2015 due to changing treatment landscape (PD-1 approvals), and a subsequent change in development focus to IO combinations. See NCT02439450.
